description:
Linux is now the top operating system on Azure, with over 60% of customer workloads running on Linux.

The post Linux Takes Over Azure: AlmaLinux Gains Azure Endorsement appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Linux Takes Over Azure: AlmaLinux Gains Azure Endorsement

description:
Miguel Guevara, Product Manager, Privacy Safety and Security at Google, discusses the complexities involved in scaling differential privacy technology across large systems.

The post Google On Scaling Differential Privacy Across Nearly Three Billion Devices appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Google On Scaling Differential Privacy Across Nearly Three Billion Devices

description:
TrueNAS SCALE 24.10 (Electric Eel) debuts Docker-based apps, RAIDZ expansion, TrueCloud backup, and revamped UI with global search.

The post TrueNAS SCALE 24.10 Shifts from Kubernetes to Docker appeared first on Linux Today.
title: TrueNAS SCALE 24.10 Shifts from Kubernetes to Docker

description:
The latest updates to our compilation of recommended open source software.

The post Best Free and Open Source Software: October 2024 Updates appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Best Free and Open Source Software: October 2024 Updates

description:
Pixel art is a form of digital art drawn with graphical software where images are built using pixels as the only building block. We recommend the best free and open source pixel art editors.

The post 11 Best Free and Open Source Pixel Art Editors appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 11 Best Free and Open Source Pixel Art Editors

description:
The GStreamer team announced the release of GStreamer 1.24.9, a new bug fix update in the stable 1.24 series of the popular cross-platform multimedia framework, focusing exclusively on stability, security, and bug fixes.

The post GStreamer 1.24.9 Rolls Out with Bug Fixes and Security Enhancements appeared first on Linux Today.
title: GStreamer 1.24.9 Rolls Out with Bug Fixes and Security Enhancements

description:
Linux Lite creator Jerry Bezencon announced today the release and general availability of Linux Lite 7.2 as the latest stable version of this Ubuntu-based distribution using the lightweight Xfce desktop environment.

The post Linux Lite 7.2 Released with Lite Theme Manager, Based on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Linux Lite 7.2 Released with Lite Theme Manager, Based on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

description:
Tails 6.9 privacy-focused Linux distro released with the latest Tor Browser 14.0.1, Tor client 0.4.8.13, and Thunderbird 115.16.

The post Tails 6.9 Now Available with Tor and Thunderbird Updates appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Tails 6.9 Now Available with Tor and Thunderbird Updates

description:
Kentik launched The Cloud Latency Map, a free public tool allowing anyone to explore the latencies measured between over 100 cloud regions worldwide. Users can identify recent changes in latencies globally between various public clouds and data center regions for the first time.

The post The Cloud Latency Map: Free Tool Measures Latency Across 100+ Cloud Regions appeared first on Linux Today.
title: The Cloud Latency Map: Free Tool Measures Latency Across 100+ Cloud Regions

description:
The Linux Rolling release model can be daunting at first glance. Learn what makes them tick and the pros and cons of using a rolling Linux distro today.

The post All You Need to Know About the Linux Rolling Release Model appeared first on Linux Today.
title: All You Need to Know About the Linux Rolling Release Model

description:
Which of the three sides are you on?

The post We Have an Official Open-Source AI Definition Now, but the Fight is Far from Over appeared first on Linux Today.
title: We Have an Official Open-Source AI Definition Now, but the Fight is Far from Over

description:
Learn how to install ttyd on Linux, find out the ttyd default port, create a ttyd systemd service, and access the server via HTTPS.

The post How to Share Your Linux Terminal Over the Web Using Ttyd appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Share Your Linux Terminal Over the Web Using Ttyd

description:
Ubuntu 25.04 “Plucky Puffin” will be Canonical’s 42nd Ubuntu release and it’s an interim one that will be supported with software and security updates for only nine months, until January 2026. It will be a release for bleeding-edge Ubuntu users who are willing to trade Ubuntu LTS’s stability with the latest technologies.

The post Ubuntu 25.04 “Plucky Puffin” Is Slated for Release on April 17th, 2025 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Ubuntu 25.04 “Plucky Puffin” Is Slated for Release on April 17th, 2025

description:
Audacity 3.7 is here three and a half months after Audacity 3.6 and promises to improve compatibility with Linux systems by addressing some issues with the AppImage bundle on Linux Mint 22 and Arch Linux, as well as another issue when building Audacity on Arch Linux.

The post Audacity 3.7 Open-Source Audio Editor Is Out to Improve Linux Compatibility appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Audacity 3.7 Open-Source Audio Editor Is Out to Improve Linux Compatibility

description:
Audacity 3.7 open-source audio editor boosts stability with improved Linux compatibility, MP3 export tweaks, and more.

The post Audacity 3.7 Rolls Out with Bug Fixes and Enhanced Linux Compatibility appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Audacity 3.7 Rolls Out with Bug Fixes and Enhanced Linux Compatibility

description:
KDE started trick or treating early, and will continue after it’s late.

The post Repent Walpurgis! It’s KDE’s Big Halloween Fundraiser Special appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Repent Walpurgis! It’s KDE’s Big Halloween Fundraiser Special
